page.title: 02ST. MARY THE VIRGIN
page.content: The following information was supplied by the{Rev. Geoffrey {Fraser,Vicar of Uffculme Parish {Church.}The earliest existing section was built in the{13th century.}In the {15th century}this was extended to make the building lighter and larger. However the more slender pillars began to lean and this can be clearly seen with the heavier original pillars still adding support in places. In {1840}the church was extended sidewards and the tower was replaced with a {spire.}The{oak rood screen dating from {1450}was added to and renovated in the {1840's}by{John Marker}who also added the spire etc.He is buried in a vault in the church and his initials can be seen on the weather cock.The Church attendance is about 100 each week.Services are held on Sunday and there is also much community use.
